performance1-1 a84b1592-6817-42da-a57c-3c13f3cfc1da 3a6e29eb-3e17-40ed-9f1e-c6c0fb8fcb76 false xvdb
/.snapshot ext3
source /root/rackspace/rackspace_admin
# ensure hostname doesn't already exist nova list | grep -q "[[:space:]]%{fqdn}[[:space:]]" && \ { echo "Error: %{fqdn} already exists"; exit 1; }
# add build-host-pubkey to rackspace profile keyname=`echo "%{build-host}" | sed "s/\./-/g"` info=`nova keypair-show $keyname 2> /dev/null` if [[ $? == 0 ]]; then # validate if [[ $info != *`echo "%{build-host-pubkey}" | tr -d '\r'`* ]] ; then echo -e "ERROR: The rackspace stored key for '$keyname' does not match the key for this machine. If the stored key is obsolete, delete it using 'nova keypair-delete $keyname' and run deploy again." exit 1 fi else # add file="/tmp/`echo $RANDOM`" echo "%{build-host-pubkey}" > $file nova keypair-add --pub-key $file $keyname rm -f $file fi
# install server # # NOTE: Use %{fqdn) as the rackspace server name to ensure that /etc/hosts and # /etc/sysconfig/network are configured, which in turn makes life easier for # network services, e.g. httpd, sendmail # nova boot \ --flavor %{rackspace-instance-flavor} \ --image %{rackspace-%{os}-image} \ --key-name $keyname \ $([[ %{rackspace-mount-volume} == true ]] && echo "--block-device-mapping %{rackspace-volume-device}=%{rackspace-volume-id}") \ %{fqdn} > /dev/null || exit 1
# activate server %{wait}
# get public ipaddress ipaddress=`nova show %{fqdn} | grep -o "accessIPv4[^|]*|[^|]*" | python -c "import sys; x=sys.stdin.readline().split()[2]; print x"`
# store ipaddress for future use echo $ipaddress > %{ssh-host-file}
# mount storage volume if [[ %{rackspace-mount-volume} == true ]] ; then ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@$ipaddress ' mkdir -p %{rackspace-volume-mount-point}; mount /dev/%{rackspace-volume-device}1 %{rackspace-volume-mount-point}; echo "/dev/%{rackspace-volume-device}1 %{rackspace-volume-mount-point} %{rackspace-volume-file-system-format} defaults,noatime,_netdev,nofail 0 2" >> /etc/fstab' || exit 1 fi
# allow client access to the repository echo "<directorymatch \"^%{localroot}/\"> SSLRequireSSL Order Deny,Allow Deny from all Allow from $ipaddress </directorymatch>" > /etc/httpd/conf.d/%{id}-%{module}.conf service httpd reload > /dev/null
# download release package echo -e "\nDownloading release package..." opts=" -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null " scp $opts %{localroot}/repo.conf root@$ipaddress:/etc/yum.repos.d/%{name}.repo ssh $opts root@$ipaddress yum -q -y install %{name}-release
